info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 8:54AM EDT until April 7 at 2:15AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
Flatrock River at Saint Paul.
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Indiana...
Haw Creek near Clifford.
Fall Creek at Millersville.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Flatrock River at Saint Paul.
* WHEN...From this morning to early Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flooding occurs along Flatrock River in southern Shelby County. Towns affected include Geneva and Flat Rock.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 6.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM EDT Saturday was 6.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.2 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around midnight EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING
